crash_analysis.html:
• Current Stress Levels: USD/JPY at 156.1570 (HIGH STRESS) indicates potential currency instability, while MOVE Index Volatility Proxy at 45.00 (RISING STRESS) shows increasing bond market turbulence. 10-Year Treasury Yield remains stable at 4.09% (NORMAL).
  • News Impact: 'Oil Prices Stable' and Big Tech rally headlines suggest short-term stability in key sectors, contradicting immediate crash signals despite FX stress.
  • Critical Triggers: Watch for USD/JPY breaking above 158 (historic intervention zone) or MOVE Index surpassing 60 (2020 crash levels).
  • Timeline Estimate: CLOSE (40-69% probability) - Elevated risk but no immediate catalyst. Potential 3-6 month window for stress accumulation if triggers are hit.

news_summary.html:
• Oil Price Stability (Yahoo Finance): Neutral impact - Suggests no immediate commodity shock but masks underlying FX/rate risks.
  • Big Tech Rally (MarketWatch): Mixed signal - While stock gains improve sentiment, concentration risk remains if rates rise unexpectedly.
  • No Major Risk-Off Headlines: Absence of banking crisis or recession news temporarily lowers crash probability but doesn't eliminate structural risks.
